slides.title: Motion & Forces
slides.content:
**Motion:**
- Distance: Total path covered
- Displacement: Shortest distance (with direction)
- Speed = Distance/Time (m/s, km/h)
- Velocity = Displacement/Time (with direction)
- Acceleration = (v-u)/t

**Equations of Motion:**
- v = u + at
- s = ut + ½at²
- v² = u² + 2as

**Newton's Laws:**
- First: Inertia
- Second: F = ma
- Third: Action-Reaction

slides.title: Energy & Power
slides.content:
**Forms of Energy:**
- Kinetic: Energy of motion (KE = ½mv²)
- Potential: Stored energy (PE = mgh)
- Heat, Light, Sound, Chemical, Nuclear

**Work & Power:**
- Work (W) = Force × Distance
- Power (P) = Work/Time
- Units: Joule (J), Watt (W)

**Conservation:**
- Energy cannot be created or destroyed
- Only converted from one form to another

slides.title: Light & Sound
slides.content:
**Light:**
- Speed: 3×10⁸ m/s
- Reflection: Bouncing back
- Refraction: Bending of light
- Mirrors: Plane, concave, convex

**Sound:**
- Travels through medium (not in vacuum)
- Speed: ~343 m/s in air
- Frequency: High pitch vs low pitch
- Echo: Reflection of sound

question.questionText: What is the SI unit of force?
question.explanation: Newton (N) is the SI unit of force
